N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 810.6 - Application procedure

State Regulations
(a) Submission of applications. Applications must be submitted in a format and in
accordance with instructions prescribed by the department. (b) Information required. The information
provided by the applicant shall include the following: (1)

The nature, duration and purpose of the
project for which the application is filed. (2)

The names and qualifications of the
personnel, including the project director, if any, responsible for the proposed
project. (3)
A description of the
facilities, staff, support services and other organizational resources
available to carry out the project. (4)

The intended number of participants in
the project, and the process by which they were identified and
selected. (5)
A description of the
plan for evaluating the proposed project. (6)
A budget for the proposed project and a
justification of the amount of grant funds requested. (7)

Analysis of the impact of the project, including its significance and/or importance from an occupational safety and
health point of view. (8)

Any other
pertinent information the Hazard Abatement Board and the department may require
to evaluate the proposed project. (c) The application must be submitted in
triplicate to the address below: Mr. Robert Ratajack, Secretary

New York State Hazard Abatement Board

Rm. 69-11

Two World Trade Center

New York, NY 10047
(d) Notice of action on application. Each
applicant will receive formal notification by the board concerning the
disposition of its grant application. Action taken on the grant may include, but shall not be limited to, the following: award of grant, denial of grant, request for additional information, request for modification of project
proposal and notification that the application is being held for consideration
due to its untimely filing. (e) Resubmission. Applications which have been previously submitted and denied may
be resubmitted only if accompanied by a statement of modification of the
original proposal, on a form prescribed by the department, except that
applications denied solely because of lack of program funds may be resubmitted
without such statement. This statement shall detail additions and/or deletions
to the previous project description. Notes
